example: The downside of living downtown is that it's always noisy and crowded.
I work in a café downtown, so I take the subway there every morning.
She prefers reading at home, whereas her brother likes studying in the library.
Remember to dial '9' before making an outside call from the office phone.
It rained unexpectedly this afternoon, so we had to cancel our picnic.
Let's narrow down the list of restaurants to those within walking distance.
The upcoming exam has been on my mind all week—I need to start studying.
He knows his way around the city well, so he can always find the best hidden spots.
I have no idea how to fix the printer—maybe we should call tech support.
If you don't know a word's meaning, look it up in the dictionary.
The sign points to the nearest bus stop, which is just around the corner.
I need to work on my resume before applying for that internship.
It's likely to rain tomorrow, so bring an umbrella with you.
She's a big reader—you'll always find her with a book in her hand.
He has no trouble understanding complex math problems—he's a natural genius.
I ran into my old high school teacher while shopping downtown yesterday.
